name: SupportMarisaAndTana
_source: speak;Tana;Oh!|You're one of Gerik's mercenaries, aren't you?
speak;Tana;Yes, that's right.|I'm Tana.|What's your name?
speak;Tana;Nice to meet you, Marisa!|I just wanted to tell you how much I appreciate you all.|Mercenaries, I mean.|It's because of you that we're doing so well.
speak;Marisa;It's my job, and I'm doing it.|No need to thank me.
speak;Tana;But I'd always heard mercenaries were renegades, cutthroats, and oath breakers.|You're nothing like that, though.|So that's why I wanted to thank you- for fighting so hard for us.
speak;Marisa;It's not out of loyalty to you or to any kingdom.|I'm happy as long as I have a chance to swing my sword.
speak;Tana;Oh...|Is that so...|But it doesn't matter to me!|You're helping us now, and I know you'd never betray us.
speak;Marisa;I don't care what you think.
speak;Tana;But-but...|Oh, wait!|Well...|She doesn't talk much, does she...
speak;Tana;What is it?|What's the matter?|Oh!|Have you never seen a pegasus?
speak;Tana;Is this your first time ever seeing a pegasus up close?
speak;Marisa;Yes.|I've fought beside pegasus knights, but I've never been this close before.
speak;Marisa;I thought they would have more delicate legs, because they fly so much.
speak;Tana;Oh, they can gallop quite quickly.|They don't always have to fly.
speak;Marisa;It is truly magnificent.|Powerful and beautiful.
speak;Tana;Would you like to touch him?|Pet his head.|Achaeus likes that.
speak;Marisa;Your pegasus is named...Achaeus...|That is a good name.|A strong name.

speak;Tana;Thanks.|Syrene named him.|She's a pegasus knight.|She's sort of my mentor.|Someday, I want to be as graceful and strong as Syrene.|And then, like Syrene, I'll pass my experiences on to the next generation.
speak;Marisa;I see.|I have no goal but to master my swordsmanship.
speak;Tana;Oh, but that's a fine dream!|Then let's keep working, shall we?
speak;Tana;Marisa, is it difficult to improve your swordsmanship?
speak;Marisa;It is.|I practice daily.|I've fought a thousand men and won each time.|And still, I have seen only the barest glimpse of what I could achieve.
speak;Tana;Really...|Maybe you shouldn't press yourself so hard.
speak;Tana;I can see how dedicated you are to becoming a better swordfighter.|But if you focus too much on a lofty goal, you might not notice when you reach it.|And I have no doubt you will reach it.
speak;Marisa;Why do you waste your time speaking with me, Princess?
speak;Tana;Oh, am I not supposed to do that?
speak;Marisa;It's not a matter of whether you should or should not.
speak;Tana;At first, I thought you were brusque and...maybe a little intimidating, too.|But you're not like that at all.|You're just shy-and a poor conversationalist.
speak;Marisa;A poor-|You know, many of my fellow swordsmen still fear me.

speak;Tana;I'm sure they do.|Your grace with the sword is something else.|But when you're not fighting, you're completely different.|More pensive.|You're so dedicated to your goal.|You have that far-off look in your eyes, like you're lost in thoughts of love or something like that.
speak;Marisa;You've already made up your mind, Princess, so there's no point in my arguing.
speak;Tana;Then we agree!|Oh, but there's one more thing.|Just call me Tana.|You don't have to keep calling me “Princess.”

speak;Tana;That's right!|So just call me Tana.|I don't want you to worry about royal titles and formality when we talk.|You say you've dedicated yourself to the sword, but...|that doesn't mean you can't have a friend or two, does it?
speak;Tana;Great! Boy, I don't know what I would have done if you'd said no.|But there it is.|We're friends now, right, Marisa?
